org.mym.plog

Interface Printer

  • All Superinterfaces:
    Interceptor
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    AbsPrinter, DebugPrinter, FilePrinter

    public interface Printer
extends Interceptor
    This interface and its subclasses define the onIntercept and output rules. Please consider it as compose of logger and controller in PLog 1.x version; or just like the "Tree" concept of Timber library.
    Since:
    2.0.0

    • Method Summary

      • Methods inherited from interface org.mym.plog.Interceptor

        onIntercept

    • Method Detail

      • getFormatter

        @Nullable
Formatter getFormatter()
        Specify the formatter of this printer.
        Returns:
        can be null. If so, msg would never be formatted.

      • getStyle

        @Nullable
Style getStyle()

      • getSoftWrapper

        SoftWrapper getSoftWrapper()
        Specify word wrapper, if needed.
        Returns:
        the soft wrapper implementation; return null means disable soft wrap for this printer. The constant implementation defined in SoftWrapper is strongly recommended.
        See Also:
        SoftWrapper.WORD_BREAK_WRAPPER, SoftWrapper.WORD_LENGTH_WRAPPER

      • getMaxLengthPerLine

        int getMaxLengthPerLine()
        Indicate how many characters should contains in one line; but only affect when soft wrap is enabled. That is, getSoftWrapper() returns not null.
        Returns:
        Should be a positive integer; otherwise you will get an argument exception.

      • print

        void print(int level,
           @NonNull
           String tag,
           @NonNull
           String msg)
        Do the real output operation, e.g. call Log.x(), or write to file.
        Parameters:
        level - print level of this log.
        msg - content of this log(already formatted and soft wrapped, if needed).
